title: fkwq-usgs-river-gauges
text:
library(glue)
library(httr)

# Read the input CSV file
sites <- read.csv("data/SouthFL_USGS_ACE_SiteList.csv")

# Specify the base URL
base_url <- "https://waterdata.usgs.gov/nwis/dv?cb_{param_code}=on&format=rdb&site_no={sta_ID}&referred_module=sw&period=&begin_date=01-01-1950&end_date=12-31-2024"

# Create a directory to save the downloaded files
output_dir <- "data/downloads"
dir.create(output_dir, showWarnings = FALSE)

# Loop through each row of the dataframe
for (i in seq_len(nrow(sites))) {
  # Extract parameters from the current row
  sta_ID <- sites$USGS_ID[i] # Replace with the actual column name
  param_code <- sites$parameter2[i] # Replace with the actual column name
  
  # Construct the URL with parameters
  query_params <- list(param1 = param1, param2 = param2)
  url <- modify_url(base_url, query = query_params)
  
  # Construct the output file name
  output_file <- file.path(output_dir, paste0("file_", i, ".csv"))
  
  # Download the file and save it locally
  tryCatch({
    GET(url, write_disk(output_file, overwrite = TRUE))
    message("Downloaded: ", output_file)
  }, error = function(e) {
    warning("Failed to download for row ", i, ": ", conditionMessage(e))
  })
}

message("All downloads completed.")

title: fkwq-usgs-river-gauges
text:
Water discharge monitoring reports by IMaRS built using quarto.

Map of USGS stations used

# Load required libraries
library(leaflet)

# Load the data
data <- read.csv("data/SouthFL_USGS_ACE_SiteList.csv")

leaflet(data) %>%
  addProviderTiles(providers$USGS.USTopo) %>%
  addCircleMarkers(
    ~Lon, ~Lat,
    label = ~Station_shortname,  # Hover labels
    radius = 5,                 # Adjust the size of the circle markers
    color = "black",             # Marker border color
    fillColor = "blue",    # Marker fill color
    fillOpacity = 0.7,          # Opacity of the fill color
    popup = ~paste("<b>Station:</b>", Station_shortname)
  )

title: Inspect Data for Given Station
text:
station_shortname <- params$station_shortname

source("R/getData.R")
df <- getData(station_shortname, "Disch")

[1] "using cached data"



# Calculate a moving average
library(zoo)


Attaching package: 'zoo'


The following objects are masked from 'package:base':

    as.Date, as.Date.numeric

k <- 30
df$moving_avg <- rollmean(df$value, k = k, fill = NA, align = "center")

# Create the time series plot
library(ggplot2)
library(glue)
ggplot(df, aes(x = datetime, y = value)) +
  geom_point(shape = 4, color = "black", alpha = 0.1) +  # Transparent blue "x"
  geom_line(aes(y = moving_avg), color = "blue", size = 1) +  # Moving average line
  labs(
    title = glue("{station_shortname} Discharge with {k}d MA"),
    x = "Datetime",
    y = "Value"
  ) +
  theme_minimal()

Warning: Using `size` aesthetic for lines was deprecated in ggplot2 3.4.0.
â„¹ Please use `linewidth` instead.

title: Southwestern Flow out of Everglades
text:
This report is temporarily disabled because station Flam is not reporting discharge data.

stations <- c(
  "BotCr",
  "Flam"
)
